name: not()
description:
• parameters:
    • negand: boolean
  • result: boolean
not(true)
// false

name: is defined()
description:
Checks if a given value is defined. A value is defined if it exists, and it is an instance of one of the FEEL data types including null.

The function can be used to check if a variable or a context entry (e.g. a property of a variable) exists. It allows differentiating between a null variable and a value that doesn't exist.

  • parameters:
    • value: any
  • result: boolean
is defined(1)
// true

is defined(null)
// true

is defined(x)
// false - if no variable "x" exists

is defined(x.y)
// false - if no variable "x" exists or it doesn't have a property "y"

name: get value()
description:
Returns the value of the context entry with the given key.

  • parameters:
    • context: context
    • key: string
  • result: any
get value({foo: 123}, "foo")
// 123

name: get entries()
description:
Returns the entries of the context as a list of key-value-pairs.

  • parameters:
    • context: context
  • result: list of context which contains two entries for "key" and "value"
get entries({foo: 123})
// [{key: "foo", value: 123}]

name: put()
description:
Add the given key and value to a context. Returns a new context that includes the entry. It might override an existing entry of the context.

Returns null if the value is not defined.

  • parameters:
    • context: context
    • key: string
    • value: any
  • result: context
put({x:1}, "y", 2)
// {x:1, y:2}

name: put all()
description:
Union the given contexts (two or more). Returns a new context that includes all entries of the given contexts. It might override context entries if the keys are equal. The entries are overridden in the same order as the contexts are passed in the method.

Returns null if one of the values is not a context.

  • parameters:
    • contexts: contexts as varargs
  • result: context
put all({x:1}, {y:2})
// {x:1, y:2}

name: date()
description:
• parameters:
    • from: string / date-time
    • or year, month, day: number
  • result: date
date(birthday)
// date("2018-04-29")

date(date and time("2012-12-25T11:00:00"))
// date("2012-12-25")

date(2012, 12, 25)
// date("2012-12-25")

name: time()
description:
• parameters:
    • from: string / date-time
    • or hour, minute, second: number
      • (optional) offset: day-time-duration
  • result: time
time(lunchTime)
// time("12:00:00")

time(date and time("2012-12-25T11:00:00"))
// time("11:00:00")

time(23, 59, 0)
// time("23:59:00")

time(14, 30, 0, duration("PT1H"))
// time("15:30:00")

name: date and time()
description:
• parameters:
    • date: date / date-time
    • time: time
    • or from: string
  • result: date-time
date and time(date("2012-12-24"),time("T23:59:00"))
// date and time("2012-12-24T23:59:00")

date and time(date and time("2012-12-25T11:00:00"),time("T23:59:00"))
// date and time("2012-12-25T23:59:00")

date and time(birthday)
// date and time("2018-04-29T009:30:00")

name: duration()
description:
• parameters:
    • from: string
  • result: day-time-duration or year-month-duration
duration(weekDays)
// duration("P5D")

duration(age)
// duration("P32Y")

name: years and months duration()
description:
• parameters:
    • from: date
    • to: date
  • result: year-month-duration
years and months duration(date("2011-12-22"), date("2013-08-24"))
// duration("P1Y8M")

name: number()
description:
• parameters:
    • from: string
  • result: number
number("1500.5")
// 1500.5

name: string()
description:
• parameters:
    • from: any
  • result: string
string(1.1)
// "1.1"

string(date("2012-12-25"))
// "2012-12-25"

name: context()
description:
Constructs a context of the given list of key-value pairs. It is the reverse function to get entries().

Each key-value pair must be a context with two entries: key and value. The entry with name key must have a value of the type string.

It might override context entries if the keys are equal. The entries are overridden in the same order as the contexts in the given list.

Returns null if one of the entries is not a context or if a context doesn't contain the required entries.

  • parameters:
    • entries: list of contexts
  • result: context
context([{"key":"a", "value":1}, {"key":"b", "value":2}])
// {a:1, b:2}

name: list contains()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • element: any
  • result: boolean
list contains([1,2,3], 2)
// true

name: count()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
  • result: number
count([1,2,3])
// 3

name: min()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
min([1,2,3])
// 1

min(1,2,3)
// 1

name: max()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
max([1,2,3])
// 3

max(1,2,3)
// 3

name: sum()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
sum([1,2,3])
// 6

sum(1,2,3)
// 6

name: product()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
product([2, 3, 4])
// 24

product(2, 3, 4)
// 24

name: mean()
description:
Returns the arithmetic mean (i.e. average).

  • parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
mean([1,2,3])
// 2

mean(1,2,3)
// 2

name: median()
description:
Returns the median element of the list of numbers.

  • parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
median(8, 2, 5, 3, 4)
// 4

median([6, 1, 2, 3])
// 2.5

name: stddev()
description:
Returns the standard deviation.

  • parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: number
stddev(2, 4, 7, 5)
// 2.0816659994661326

stddev([2, 4, 7, 5])
// 2.0816659994661326

name: mode()
description:
Returns the mode of the list of numbers.

  • parameters:
    • list: list of numbers
    • or numbers as varargs
  • result: list of numbers
mode(6, 3, 9, 6, 6)
// [6]

mode([6, 1, 9, 6, 1])
// [1, 6]

name: and()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of booleans
    • or booleans as varargs
  • result: boolean
and([true,false])
// false

and(false,null,true)
// false

name: all()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of booleans
    • or booleans as varargs
  • result: boolean
and([true,false])
// false

and(false,null,true)
// false

name: or()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of booleans
    • or booleans as varargs
  • result: boolean
or([false,true])
// true

or(false,null,true)
// true

name: any()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list of booleans
    • or booleans as varargs
  • result: boolean
or([false,true])
// true

or(false,null,true)
// true

name: sublist()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • start position: number
    • (optional) length: number
  • result: list
sublist([1,2,3], 2)
// [2,3]

sublist([1,2,3], 1, 2)
// [1,2]

name: append()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • items: elements as varargs
  • result: list
append([1], 2, 3)
// [1,2,3]

name: concatenate()
description:
• parameters:
    • lists: lists as varargs
  • result: list
concatenate([1,2],[3])
// [1,2,3]

concatenate([1],[2],[3])
// [1,2,3]

name: insert before()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • position: number
    • newItem: any
  • result: list
insert before([1,3],1,2)
// [1,2,3]

name: remove()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • position: number
  • result: list
remove([1,2,3], 2)
// [1,3]

name: reverse()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
  • result: list
reverse([1,2,3])
// [3,2,1]

name: index of()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • match: any
  • result: list of numbers
index of([1,2,3,2],2)
// [2,4]

name: union()
description:
• parameters:
    • lists: lists as varargs
  • result: list
union([1,2],[2,3])
// [1,2,3]

name: distinct values()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
  • result: list
distinct values([1,2,3,2,1])
// [1,2,3]

name: flatten()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
  • result: list
flatten([[1,2],[[3]], 4])
// [1,2,3,4]

name: sort()
description:
• parameters:
    • list: list
    • precedes: function with two arguments and boolean result
  • result: list
sort(list: [3,1,4,5,2], precedes: function(x,y) x < y)
// [1,2,3,4,5]

name: string join()
description:
This joins a list of strings into a single string. This is similar to Java's joining function.

If an item of the list is null, the item is ignored for the result string. If an item is neither a string nor null, the function returns null instead of a string.

  • Parameters:
    • list: The list of strings to join
    • delimiter: (Optional) The string used between each element (default: empty string)
    • prefix: (Optional) The string used at the beginning of the joined result (default: empty string)
    • suffix: (Optional) The string used at the end of the joined result (default: empty string)
  • Result: The joined list as a string
string join(["a","b","c"])
// "abc"
string join(["a"], "X")
// "a"
string join(["a","b","c"], ", ")
// "a, b, c"
string join(["a","b","c"], ", ", "[", "]")
// "[a, b, c]"
string join(["a",null,"c"])
// "ac"
string join([])
// ""

name: decimal()
description:
Round the given number at the given scale using the given rounding mode. If no rounding mode is passed in, it uses HALF_EVEN as default.

  • parameters:
    • n: number
    • scale: number
    • (optional) mode: string - one of UP, DOWN, CEILING, FLOOR, HALF_UP, HALF_DOWN, HALF_EVEN, UNNECESSARY (default: HALF_EVEN)
  • result: number
decimal(1/3, 2)
// .33

decimal(1.5, 0)
// 2

decimal(2.5, 0, "half_up")
// 3

name: floor()
description:
• parameters:
    • n: number
  • result: number
floor(1.5)
// 1

floor(-1.5)
// -2

name: ceiling()
description:
Round the given number at the given scale using the ceiling rounding mode.

  • parameters:
    • n: number
  • result: number
ceiling(1.5)
// 2

ceiling(-1.5)
// -1

name: abs()
description:
Returns the absolute value of the given numeric value.

  • parameters:
    • number: number
  • result: number
abs(10)
// 10

abs(-10)
// 10

name: modulo()
description:
Returns the remainder of the division of dividend by divisor.

  • parameters:
    • dividend: number
    • divisor: number
  • result: number
modulo(12, 5)
// 2

name: sqrt()
description:
Returns the square root.

  • parameters:
    • number: number
  • result: number
sqrt(16)
// 4

name: log()
description:
Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of the number.

  • parameters:
    • number: number
  • result: number
log(10)
// 2.302585092994046

name: exp()
description:
Returns the Eulerâ€™s number e raised to the power of number .

  • parameters:
    • number: number
  • result: number
exp(5)
// 148.4131591025766

name: odd()
description:
Returns true if the given numeric value is odd. Otherwise, it returns false.

  • parameters:
    • number: number
  • result: boolean
odd(5)
// true

odd(2)
// false

name: even()
description:
Returns true if the given numeric value is even. Otherwise, it returns false.

  • parameters:
    • number: number
  • result: boolean
even(5)
// false

even(2)
// true

name: before()
description:
• parameters:
    • point1, point2: any
    • or range: range, point: any
    • or point: any, range: range
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
before(1, 10)
// true

before(10, 1)
// false

before(1, [2..5])
// true

before([1..5], 10)
// true

before([1..5], [6..10])
// true

before([1..5),[5..10])
// true

name: after()
description:
• parameters:
    • point1, point2: any
    • or range: range, point: any
    • or point: any, range: range
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
after(10, 1)
// true

after(1, 10)
// false

after(12, [2..5])
// true

([1..5], 10)
// false

before([6..10], [1..5])
// true

before([5..10], [1..5))
// true

name: meets()
description:
• parameters:
    • range1: range
    • range2: range
  • result: boolean
meets([1..5], [5..10])
// true

meets([1..3], [4..6])
// false

meets([1..3], [3..5])
// true

meets([1..5], (5..8])
// false

name: met by()
description:
• parameters:
    • range1: range
    • range2: range
  • result: boolean
met by([5..10], [1..5])
// true

met by([3..4], [1..2])
// false

met by([3..5], [1..3])
// true

met by((5..8], [1..5))
// false

met by([5..10], [1..5))
// false

name: overlaps()
description:
• parameters:
    • range1: range
    • range2: range
  • result: boolean
overlaps([5..10], [1..6])
// true

overlaps((3..7], [1..4])
// true

overlaps([1..3], (3..6])
// false

overlaps((5..8], [1..5))
// false

overlaps([4..10], [1..5))
// treu

name: overlaps before()
description:
• parameters:
    • range1: range
    • range2: range
  • result: boolean
overlaps before([1..5], [4..10])
// true

overlaps before([3..4], [1..2])
// false

overlaps before([1..3], (3..5])
// false

overlaps before([1..5), (3..8])
// true

overlaps before([1..5), [5..10])
// false

name: overlaps after()
description:
• parameters:
    • range1: range
    • range2: range
  • result: boolean
overlaps after([4..10], [1..5])
// true

overlaps after([3..4], [1..2])
// false

overlaps after([3..5], [1..3))
// false

overlaps after((5..8], [1..5))
// false

overlaps after([4..10], [1..5))
// true

name: finishes()
description:
• parameters:
    • point: any, range: range
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
finishes(5, [1..5])
// true

finishes(10, [1..7])
// false

finishes([3..5], [1..5])
// true

finishes((1..5], [1..5))
// false

finishes([5..10], [1..10))
// false

name: finished by()
description:
• parameters:
    • range: range, point: any
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
finishes by([5..10], 10)
// true

finishes by([3..4], 2)
// false

finishes by([3..5], [1..5])
// true

finishes by((5..8], [1..5))
// false

finishes by([5..10], (1..10))
// true

name: includes()
description:
• parameters:
    • range: range, point: any
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
includes([5..10], 6)
// true

includes([3..4], 5)
// false

includes([1..10], [4..6])
// true

includes((5..8], [1..5))
// false

includes([1..10], [1..5))
// true

name: during()
description:
• parameters:
    • point: any, range: range
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
during(5, [1..10])
// true

during(12, [1..10])
// false

during(1, (1..10])
// false

during([4..6], [1..10))
// true

during((1..5], (1..10])
// true

name: starts()
description:
• parameters:
    • point: any, range: range
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
starts(1, [1..5])
// true

starts(1, (1..8])
// false

starts((1..5], [1..5])
// false

starts([1..10], [1..10])
// true

starts((1..10), (1..10))
// true

name: started by()
description:
• parameters:
    • range: range, point: any
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
started by([1..10], 1)
// true

started by((1..10], 1)
// false

started by([1..10], [1..5])
// true

started by((1..10], [1..5))
// false

started by([1..10], [1..10))
// true

name: coincides()
description:
• parameters:
    • point1, point2: any
    • or range1, range2: range
  • result: boolean
coincides(5, 5)
// true

coincides(3, 4)
// false

coincides([1..5], [1..5])
// true

coincides((1..5], [1..5))
// false

coincides([1..5], [2..6])
// false

name: substring()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
    • start position: number
    • (optional) length: number
  • result: string
substring("foobar",3)
// "obar"

substring("foobar",3,3)
// "oba"

name: string length()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
  • result: number
string length("foo")
// 3

name: upper case()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
  • result: string
upper case("aBc4")
// "ABC4"

name: lower case()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
  • result: string
lower case("aBc4")
// "abc4"

name: substring before()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
    • match: string
  • result: string
substring before("foobar", "bar")
// "foo"

name: substring after()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
    • match: string
  • result: string
substring after("foobar", "ob")
// "ar"

name: contains()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
    • match: string
  • result: boolean
contains("foobar", "of")
// false

name: starts with()
description:
• parameters:
    • input: string
    • match: string
  • result: boolean
starts with("foobar", "fo")
// true

name: ends with()
description:
• parameters:
    • input: string
    • match: string
  • result: boolean
ends with("foobar", "r")
// true

name: matches()
description:
• parameters:
    • input: string
    • pattern: string (regular expression)
  • result: boolean
matches("foobar", "^fo*bar")
// true

name: replace()
description:
• parameters:
    • input: string
    • pattern: string (regular expression)
    • replacement: string (e.g. $1 returns the first match group)
    • (optional) flags: string ("s", "m", "i", "x")
  • result: string
replace("abcd", "(ab)|(a)", "[1=$1][2=$2]")
// "[1=ab][2=]cd"

replace("0123456789", "(\d{3})(\d{3})(\d{4})", "($1) $2-$3")
// "(012) 345-6789"

name: split()
description:
• parameters:
    • string: string
    • delimiter: string (regular expression)
  • result: list of strings
split("John Doe", "\s" )
// ["John", "Doe"]

split("a;b;c;;", ";")
// ["a", "b", "c", "", ""]

name: extract()
description:
Returns all matches of the pattern in the given string. Returns an empty list if the pattern doesn't match.

  • parameters:
    • string: string
    • pattern: string (regular expression)
  • result: list of strings
extract("references are 1234, 1256, 1378", "12[0-9]*")
// ["1234","1256"]

name: now()
description:
Returns the current date and time including the timezone.

  • parameters: no
  • result: date-time with timezone
now()
// date and time("2020-07-31T14:27:30@Europe/Berlin")

name: today()
description:
Returns the current date.

  • parameters: no
  • result: date
today()
// date("2020-07-31")

name: day of week()
description:
Returns the day of the week according to the Gregorian calendar. Note that it always returns the English name of the day.

  • parameters:
    • date: date/date-time
  • result: string
day of week(date("2019-09-17"))
// "Tuesday"

name: day of year()
description:
Returns the Gregorian number of the day within the year.

  • parameters:
    • date: date/date-time
  • result: number
day of year(date("2019-09-17"))
// 260

name: week of year()
description:
Returns the Gregorian number of the week within the year, according to ISO 8601.

  • parameters:
    • date: date/date-time
  • result: number
week of year(date("2019-09-17"))
// 38

name: month of year()
description:
Returns the month of the week according to the Gregorian calendar. Note that it always returns the English name of the month.

  • parameters:
    • date: date/date-time
  • result: string
month of year(date("2019-09-17"))
// "September"

name: abs()
description:
Returns the absolute value of a given duration.

  • parameters:
    • n: days-time-duration/years-months-duration
  • result: duration
abs(duration("-PT5H"))
// "duration("PT5H")"

abs(duration("PT5H"))
// "duration("PT5H")"

abs(duration("-P2M"))
// duration("P2M")
